result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:35 pm 
INCLUDES 22CF485, 20CF1275, 21CF395, & 22CF104. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu (Special Appearance). 

**WARRANT(S) QUASHED**

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 22CF485. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $1500 cash bond to cover all files- CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with co-deft: CB. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 2 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 5/11/2022 at 3:10 pm. 
RH: 4/29/2022 at 1pm in Courtroom B. 
Prelim: 5/4/2022 at 9:10 am in Br. 4.

INCLUDES 22CF485, 20CF1275, 21CF395 & 22CF104.  No contact with co-defendant: CB.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
